body:
# TimeZone [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/imdrasil/time_zone.svg)](https://travis-ci.org/imdrasil/time_zone) [![Latest Release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/imdrasil/time_zone.svg)](https://github.com/imdrasil/time_zone/releases) [![Docs](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-available-brightgreen.svg)](https://imdrasil.github.io/time_zone/latest/)

**Time Zone** provides daylight savings aware transformations between times in different time zones. Also this is a port of ruby [tzinfo](https://github.com/tzinfo/tzinfo) gem.

## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  time_zone:
    github: imdrasil/time_zone
```

## Usage

The following code will obtain the America/New_York timezone (as an instance
of `TZInfo::Timezone`) and convert a time in UTC to local New York time:

```crystal
require "time_zone"

tz = TimeZone::Zone.get("America/New_York")
local = tz.utc_to_local(Time.utc(2005,8,29,15,35,0))
```

Note that the local Time returned will be kind of UTC (`local.kind` will
return `Time::Kind::Utc`). This is because the Crystal `Time` class only supports two timezones:
* UTC 
* the current system local timezone.

To convert from a local time to UTC, the `#local_to_utc` method can be used as
follows:

```crystal
utc = tz.local_to_utc(local)
```

Note that the time zone information of the local Time object is ignored (TimeZone
will just read the date and time and treat them as if there were in the `tz`
timezone). The following two lines will return the same result regardless of
the system's local timezone:

```crystal
tz.local_to_utc(Time.new(2006,6,26,1,0,0))
tz.local_to_utc(Time.utc(2006,6,26,1,0,0))
```

The current local time in a `Zone` can be obtained with the
`TimeZone::Zone#now` method:

```crystal
now = tz.now
```

A list of all the available timezone identifiers can be obtained using the
`TimeZone::Zone.all_identifiers` method. `TimeZone::Zone.all` can be called
to get an `Array` of all the `TimeZone::Zone` and `TimeZone::LinkedZone` instances.

Timezones can also be accessed by country (using an ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country
code). The following code retrieves the `TimeZone::Country` instance representing
the USA (country code 'US') and then gets all the timezone identifiers used in
the USA.

```crystal
us = TimeZone::Country.get('US')
timezones = us.zone_identifiers
```

A list of all the available country codes can be obtained using the
`TimeZone::Country.all_codes` method. `TimeZone::Country.all` can be called to get
an `Array` of all the `Country` instances.

### TimeZone::Time

To hold time zone in the time object `TimeZone::Time` struct could be used. It provides almost same interface as the `Time` does. Also there is 2 methods added to `Time`:
- `#to_time_zone_time` - converts current time object to `TimeZone::Time` in default time zone;
- `::zone` - returns default time zone.

To set or get default time zone next code can be used:

```crystal
TimeZone::Zone.default # tries to read time zone from `TZ`
					   # environment variable, otherwise UTC 
					   # will be used
TimeZone::Zone.default = "America/New_York"
# or
TimeZone::Zone.default = TimeZone::Zone.get("America/New_York")
```

To create specific date in time zone:

```crystal
zone.new(2010, 10, 19)
Time.zone.new(2012, 12, 12) # in the default time zone
```

Also `TimeZone::Time` could be parsed from string with grepping given time zone offset:

```crystal
# Time zone will be set to Etc/GMT-5
TimeZone::Time.parse("2014-10-31 10:11:12 +05:00", "%F %T %z")
```

## Development

### Data Generating

All code in `src/time_zone/data` folder is automatically generated so please don't try to make any change there because they will be lost after next regenerating. To generate new version please paste all files from original [repo](https://github.com/eggert/tz) to the `data` folder in the this repo root and invoke `ruby scripts/build.rb`.

## Contributing

1. Fork it ( https://github.com/imdrasil/time_zone/fork )
2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature)
3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature')
4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature)
5. Create a new Pull Request

## Contributors

- [imdrasil](https://github.com/[your-github-name]) Roman Kalnytskyi - creator, maintainer

types.name: Time
types.doc:
`Time` represents an instance in time. Here are some examples:

### Basic Usage

```
time = Time.new(2016, 2, 15, 10, 20, 30)

time.year    # => 2016
time.month   # => 2
time.day     # => 15
time.hour    # => 10
time.minute  # => 20
time.second  # => 30
time.monday? # => true

# Creating a time instance with a date only
Time.new(2016, 2, 15) # => 2016-02-15 00:00:00

# Specifying a time
Time.new(2016, 2, 15, 10, 20, 30) # => 2016-02-15 10:20:30

# Creating a time instance in UTC
Time.utc(2016, 2, 15, 10, 20, 30) # => 2016-02-15 10:20:30 UTC
```

### Formatting Time

The `to_s` method returns a `String` value in the assigned format.

```
time = Time.new(2015, 10, 12)
time.to_s("%Y-%m-%d") # => "2015-10-12"
```

See `Time::Format` for all the directives.

### Calculation

```
Time.new(2015, 10, 10) - 5.days # => 2015-10-05 00:00:00

# Time calculation returns a Time::Span instance
span = Time.new(2015, 10, 10) - Time.new(2015, 9, 10)
span.days          # => 30
span.total_hours   # => 720
span.total_minutes # => 43200

# Calculation between Time::Span instances
span_a = Time::Span.new(3, 0, 0)
span_b = Time::Span.new(2, 0, 0)
span = span_a - span_b
span       # => 01:00:00
span.class # => Time::Span
span.hours # => 1
```
types.summary: Time represents an instance in time.

types.name: TimeZone
types.doc:
Specifies the format to convert a `TimeZone::Time` to and from a `String`.

The pattern of a format is a `String` with directives. Directives
being with a percent (`%`) character. Any text not listed as a directive
will be passed/parsed through the output/input string. Forks same as `Time`.

The directives are:

* **%a**: short day name (Sun, Mon, Tue, ...)
* **%^a**: short day name, upcase (SUN, MON, TUE, ...)
* **%A**: day name (Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, ...)
* **%^A**: day name, upcase (SUNDAY, MONDAY, TUESDAY, ...)
* **%b**: short month name (Jan, Feb, Mar, ...)
* **%^b**: short month name, upcase (JAN, FEB, MAR, ...)
* **%B**: month name (January, February, March, ...)
* **%^B**: month name, upcase (JANUARY, FEBRUARY, MARCH, ...)
* **%c**: date and time (Tue Apr  5 10:26:19 2016)
* **%C**: year divided by 100
* **%d**: day of month, zero padded (01, 02, ...)
* **%-d**: day of month (1, 2, ..., 31)
* **%D**: date (04/05/16)
* **%e**: day of month, blank padded (" 1", " 2", ..., "10", "11", ...)
* **%F**: ISO 8601 date (2016-04-05)
* **%h**: (same as %b) short month name (Jan, Feb, Mar, ...)
* **%H**: hour of the day, 24-hour clock, zero padded (00, 01, ..., 24)
* **%I**: hour of the day, 12-hour clock, zero padded (00, 01, ..., 12)
* **%j**: day of year, zero padded (001, 002, ..., 365)
* **%k**: hour of the day, 24-hour clock, blank padded (" 0", " 1", ..., "24")
* **%l**: hour of the day, 12-hour clock, blank padded (" 0", " 1", ..., "12")
* **%3N**, **%L**: milliseconds, zero padded (000, 001, ..., 999)
* **%6N**: microseconds, zero padded (000000, 000001, ..., 999999)
* **%9N**: nanoseconds, zero padded (000000000, 000000001, ..., 999999999)
* **%N**: second fraction, zero padded. (Same as `%9N` but may consume more than 9 digits while parsing)
* **%m**: month number, zero padded (01, 02, ..., 12)
* **%_m**: month number, blank padded (" 1", " 2", ..., "12")
* **%-m**: month number (1, 2, ..., 12)
* **%M**: minute, zero padded (00, 01, 02, ..., 59)
* **%p**: am-pm (lowercase)
* **%P**: AM-PM (uppercase)
* **%r**: 12-hour time (03:04:05 AM)
* **%R**: 24-hour time (13:04)
* **%s**: seconds since unix epoch (see `Time.epoch`)
* **%S**: seconds, zero padded (00, 01, ..., 59)
* **%T**: 24-hour time (13:04:05)
* **%u**: day of week (Monday is 1, 1..7)
* **%w**: day of week (Sunday is 0, 0..6)
* **%x**: (same as %D) date (04/05/16)
* **%X**: (same as %T) 24-hour time (13:04:05)
* **%y**: year modulo 100
* **%Y**: year, zero padded
* **%z**: time zone as hour and minute offset from UTC (+0900)
* **%:z**: time zone as hour and minute offset from UTC with a colon (+09:00)
* **%::z**: time zone as hour, minute and second offset from UTC with a colon (+09:00:00)
types.summary: Specifies the format to convert a TimeZone::Time to and from a String.

def.name: bsearch
def.body:
i = bsearch_index(ary) do |val, i|
  yield val
end
if i
  return ary[i.not_nil!]
end

def.name: bsearch_index
def.body:
low = 0
high = ary.size
mid = 0
while low < high
  mid = low + ((high - low) / 2)
  v = yield ary[mid], mid
  case v
  when 0
    return mid
  when 1
    high = mid
  when -1
    low = mid + 1
  else
    raise("Wrong return argument")
  end
end
if low == ary.size
  return nil
end
low

def.name: get
def.body:
begin
  @@countries[code]
rescue e : KeyError
  raise(InvalidCountryCode.new(code))
end

instance_methods.name: epoch
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a new `TimeZone::Time` instance that corresponds to the number
seconds elapsed since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970).

```
zone = TimeZone::Zone.get("HST")
zone.epoch(981173106) # => 2001-02-03 04:05:06 UTC
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a new TimeZone::Time instance that corresponds to the number seconds elapsed since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970).

instance_methods.name: epoch_ms
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a new `TimeZone::Time` instance that corresponds to the number
milliseconds elapsed since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970).

```
zone = TimeZone::Zone.get("HST")
time = zone.epoch_ms(981173106789) # => 2001-02-03 04:05:06.789 UTC
time.millisecond                   # => 789
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a new TimeZone::Time instance that corresponds to the number milliseconds elapsed since the unix epoch (00:00:00 UTC on 1 January 1970).

def.name: epoch_ms
def.body:
milliseconds = milliseconds.to_i64
seconds = ::Time::UNIX_SECONDS + (milliseconds / 1000)
nanoseconds = (milliseconds % 1000) * ::Time::NANOSECONDS_PER_MILLISECOND
new(seconds: seconds, nanoseconds: nanoseconds.to_i)

def.name: friendly_identifier
def.body:
parts = identifier.split('/')
if parts.size == 1
  parts[0]
else
  prefix = skip_first_part ? nil : "#{parts[0]} - "
  parts = parts[1..-1].map do |part|
    part = part.gsub(/_/, ' ')
    if part.index(/[a-z]/)
      part = part.gsub(/([^M][a-z])([A-Z])/) do |_, matched|
        "#{matched[1]} #{matched[2]}"
      end
      part = part.gsub(/([A-Z])([A-Z])/) do |_, matched|
        "#{matched[1]}'#{matched[2]}"
      end
    end
    part
  end
  "#{prefix}#{parts.reverse.join(", ")}"
end

def.name: to_local
def.body:
if same_as?(time.zone)
  time
else
  utc_time = time.zone.local_to_utc(time.to_time)
  epoch((utc_to_local(utc_time)).epoch)
end

instance_methods.doc: Using UTC timestamps
instance_methods.summary: Using UTC timestamps

def.body:
if @start_transition.timestamp > time
  1
else
  if @end_transition.timestamp <= time
    -1
  else
    0
  end
end

instance_methods.name: add
instance_methods.doc: All periods should be added in ordered manner.
instance_methods.summary: All periods should be added in ordered manner.

def.name: find_in_local
def.body:
minimum_possible_time = time - MAXIMUM_OFFSET
maximum_possible_time = time + MAXIMUM_OFFSET
period1 = find_in_utc(minimum_possible_time)
period2 = find_in_utc(maximum_possible_time)
if period1 == period2
  return period1
end
period1_satisfied = period1.in_clock_time?(time)
period2_satisfied = period2.in_clock_time?(time)
if period1_satisfied && period2_satisfied
  case dst
  when :none
    raise(AmbiguousTime.new(::Time.epoch(time)))
  when :dst
    if period1.dst?
      return period1
    end
    if period2.dst?
      return period2
    end
    raise(AmbiguousTime.new(::Time.epoch(time)))
  when :sdt
    if period1.dst?
    else
      return period1
    end
    if period2.dst?
    else
      return period2
    end
    raise(AmbiguousTime.new(::Time.epoch(time)))
  else
    raise(ArgumentError.new("Wrong dst argument"))
  end
else
  if period1_satisfied
    period1
  else
    period2
  end
end

def.name: find_in_utc
def.body:
if @cached_period
  cp = @cached_period.not_nil!
  if cp.includes?(time)
    return cp
  end
end
cp = bsearch(@periods) do |period|
  period <=> time
end
if cp
  @cached_period = cp
  return cp.not_nil!
else
  raise(AmbiguousTime.new(::Time.epoch(time)))
end

def.name: country
def.body:
builder = CountryBuilder.new(code, name)
yield builder
builder.build

instance_methods.name: timezone
instance_methods.args_string: (name, lat_nom, lat_denom, lng_nom, lng_denom, comment = "")

def.name: build
def.body:
set = if @transitions.size == 0
  FixedOffsetPeriodSet.new([FixedOffsetPeriod.new(@offsets[:o0])] of IPeriod)
else
  periods = [] of IPeriod
  @transitions[0].tap do |t|
    periods << (StartPeriod.new(t, @offsets[:o0]))
  end
  previous_transition = nil
  @transitions.each do |t|
    if previous_transition
      pt = previous_transition.not_nil!
      periods << (Period.new(pt, t, pt.offset))
    end
    previous_transition = t
  end
  @transitions[-1].tap do |t|
    periods << (LastPeriod.new(t, t.offset))
  end
  PeriodSet.new(periods)
end
Zone.add(Zone.new(name, set))

def.name: new
def.body:
seconds = UNIX_SECONDS + time.tv_sec
nanoseconds = time.tv_nsec.to_i
Zone.default.new(seconds: seconds, nanoseconds: nanoseconds)

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (*, seconds : Int64, nanoseconds : Int32, zone, period)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(seconds: seconds, nanoseconds: nanoseconds, zone: zone, period: period)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

constructors.name: parse
constructors.doc:
Parses a TimeZone::Time in the given *time* string, using the given *pattern* (see
`TimeZone::Time::Format`).

```
TimeZone::Time.parse("2016-04-05", "%F") # => 2016-04-05 00:00:00
```
constructors.summary: Parses a TimeZone::Time in the given time string, using the given pattern (see TimeZone::Time::Format).
constructors.args_string: (time : String, pattern : String, zone : Zone? = nil) : Time

instance_methods.doc:
Returns the amount of time between *other* and `self`.

The amount can be negative if `self` is a `TimeZone::Time` that happens before *other*.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the amount of time between other and self.

def.body:
if zone != other.zone
  to_utc - other.to_utc
else
  Span.new(seconds: total_seconds - other.total_seconds, nanoseconds: nanosecond - other.nanosecond)
end

if zone.same_as?(other.zone)
  own_utc, other_utc = self, other
else
  own_utc, other_utc = to_utc, other.to_utc
end
cmp = own_utc.total_seconds <=> other_utc.total_seconds
if cmp == 0
  cmp = own_utc.nanosecond <=> other_utc.nanosecond
end
cmp

instance_methods.doc: `other` will be considered in UTC.
instance_methods.summary: other will be considered in UTC.

def.body:
own_utc = to_utc
cmp = own_utc.seconds <=> other.total_seconds
if cmp == 0
  cmp = own_utc.nanosecond <=> other.nanosecond
end
cmp

instance_methods.name: add_span
instance_methods.doc: Returns a `Time` that is this number of *seconds* and *nanoseconds* later.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a Time that is this number of seconds and nanoseconds later.

def.name: add_span
def.body:
seconds = total_seconds + seconds
nanoseconds = self.nanosecond.to_i64 + nanoseconds
seconds = seconds + (nanoseconds.tdiv(::Time::NANOSECONDS_PER_SECOND))
nanoseconds = nanoseconds.remainder(::Time::NANOSECONDS_PER_SECOND)
if nanoseconds < 0
  seconds = seconds - 1
  nanoseconds = nanoseconds + ::Time::NANOSECONDS_PER_SECOND
end
if 0 <= seconds && seconds <= ::Time::MAX_SECONDS
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Invalid time"))
end
zone.new(seconds: seconds, nanoseconds: nanoseconds.to_i)

instance_methods.name: at_beginning_of_day
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the day that contains `self` starts.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the day that contains self starts.

def.name: at_beginning_of_day
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, day)

instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the hour that contains `self` starts.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the hour that contains self starts.

year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, day, hour)

instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the minute that contains self starts.

def.name: at_beginning_of_minute
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, day, hour, minute)

instance_methods.name: at_beginning_of_month
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the month that contains `self` starts.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the month that contains self starts.

def.name: at_beginning_of_month
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, 1)

instance_methods.name: at_beginning_of_quarter
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the quarter that contains `self` starts.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the quarter that contains self starts.

def.name: at_beginning_of_quarter
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, (((month - 1) / 3) * 3) + 1, 1)

instance_methods.name: at_beginning_of_semester
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the semester that contains `self` starts.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the semester that contains self starts.

def.name: at_beginning_of_semester
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, (((month - 1) / 6) * 6) + 1, 1)

instance_methods.name: at_beginning_of_year
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the year that contains `self` starts.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the year that contains self starts.

def.name: at_beginning_of_year
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, 1, 1)

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_day
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the day that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the day that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_day
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, day, 23, 59, 59, nanosecond: 999999999)

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_hour
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the hour that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the hour that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_hour
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, day, hour, 59, 59, nanosecond: 999999999)

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_minute
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the minute that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the minute that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_minute
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, day, hour, minute, 59, nanosecond: 999999999)

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_month
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the month that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the month that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_month
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, ::Time.days_in_month(year, month), 23, 59, 59, nanosecond: 999999999)

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_quarter
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the quarter-year that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the quarter-year that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_quarter
def.body:
year, month = year_month_day_day_year
if month <= 3
  month, day = 3, 31
else
  if month <= 6
    month, day = 6, 30
  else
    if month <= 9
      month, day = 9, 30
    else
      month, day = 12, 31
    end
  end
end
zone.new(year, month, day, 23, 59, 59, nanosecond: 999999999)

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_semester
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the half-year that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the half-year that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_semester
def.body:
year, month = year_month_day_day_year
if month <= 6
  month, day = 6, 30
else
  month, day = 12, 31
end
zone.new(year, month, day, 23, 59, 59, nanosecond: 999999999)

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_year
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the year that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the year that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_year
def.body:
year, month, day, day_year = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, 12, 31, 23, 59, 59, nanosecond: 999999999)

instance_methods.name: at_midday
instance_methods.doc: Returns the midday (12:00) of the day represented by `self`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the midday (12:00) of the day represented by self.

def.name: at_midday
def.body:
year, month, day = year_month_day_day_year
zone.new(year, month, day, 12, 0, 0, nanosecond: 0)

instance_methods.name: date
instance_methods.doc: Returns a copy of `self` with time-of-day components (hour, minute, ...) set to zero.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a copy of self with time-of-day components (hour, minute, ...) set to zero.

instance_methods.name: local?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if time is in the default zone.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if time is in the default zone.

instance_methods.name: to_local
instance_methods.doc: Returns a copy of this `TimeZone::Time` converted to the local time zone.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a copy of this TimeZone::Time converted to the local time zone.

def.name: to_local
def.body:
if local?
  self
else
  Zone.default.to_local(self)
end

instance_methods.name: to_utc
instance_methods.doc: Returns a copy of this `TimeZone::Time` converted to UTC.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a copy of this TimeZone::Time converted to UTC.

instance_methods.name: utc?
instance_methods.doc: Returns `true` if `zone` is set to *Utc*.
instance_methods.summary: Returns true if #zone is set to Utc.

instance_methods.doc: Returns a `TimeZone::Time` that is later than this `TimeZone::Time` by the `Time::Span` *span*.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a TimeZone::Time that is later than this TimeZone::Time by the Time::Span span.

instance_methods.doc: Adds a number of months specified by *other*'s value.
instance_methods.summary: Adds a number of months specified by other's value.

instance_methods.doc: Returns a `TimeZone::Time` that is earlier than this `TimeZone::Time` by the `Time::Span` *span*.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a TimeZone::Time that is earlier than this TimeZone::Time by the Time::Span span.

instance_methods.doc: Subtracts a number of months specified by *other*'s value.
instance_methods.summary: Subtracts a number of months specified by other's value.

instance_methods.name: at_beginning_of_week
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the week that includes `self` starts.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the week that includes self starts.

def.name: at_beginning_of_week
def.body:
dow = day_of_week.value
if dow == 0
  (self - 6.days).at_beginning_of_day
else
  (self - (dow - 1).days).at_beginning_of_day
end

instance_methods.name: at_end_of_week
instance_methods.doc: Returns the time when the week that includes `self` ends.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the time when the week that includes self ends.

def.name: at_end_of_week
def.body:
dow = day_of_week.value
if dow == 0
  at_end_of_day
else
  (self + (7 - dow).days).at_end_of_day
end

instance_methods.name: day
instance_methods.doc: Returns the day number of the month (`1..31`).
instance_methods.summary: Returns the day number of the month (1..31).

instance_methods.summary: Returns the day of the week (Sunday..Saturday).

instance_methods.summary: Returns the day number of the year (1..365, or 1..366 on leap years).

instance_methods.name: epoch
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the number of seconds since the Epoch for this time.

```
time = TimeZone::Time.parse("2016-01-12 03:04:05 UTC", "%F %T %z")
time.epoch # => 1452567845
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns the number of seconds since the Epoch for this time.

instance_methods.name: epoch_f
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the number of seconds since the Epoch for this time,
as a `Float64`.

```
time = TimeZone::Time.parse("2016-01-12 03:04:05.678 UTC", "%F %T.%L %z")
time.epoch_f # => 1452567845.678
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns the number of seconds since the Epoch for this time, as a Float64.

instance_methods.name: epoch_ms
instance_methods.doc:
Returns the number of milliseconds since the Epoch for this time.

```
time = TimeZone::Time.parse("2016-01-12 03:04:05.678 UTC", "%F %T.%L %z")
time.epoch_ms # => 1452567845678
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns the number of milliseconds since the Epoch for this time.

instance_methods.summary: Returns the hour of the day (0..23).

def.name: inspect
def.body:
(Format.new("%F %T")).format(self, io)
if utc?
  io << " UTC"
else
  (Format.new(" %:z")).format(self, io)
end
io

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Creates a new `TimeZone::Time::Format` with the given *pattern*. The given time
*zone* will be used when parsing a `Time` and no time zone is found in it.

def.name: day_of_week_monday_1_7
def.body:
v = time.day_of_week.value
if v == 0
  v = 7
end
io << v

def.name: pad2
def.body:
if value < 10
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
io << value

def.name: pad3
def.body:
if value < 100
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
pad2(value, padding)

def.name: pad4
def.body:
if value < 1000
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
pad3(value, padding)

def.name: pad6
def.body:
if value < 100000
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
if value < 10000
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
pad4(value, padding)

def.name: pad9
def.body:
if value < 100000000
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
if value < 10000000
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
if value < 1000000
  io.write_byte(padding.ord.to_u8)
end
pad6(value, padding)

def.name: time_zone
def.body:
if time.zone.utc?
  io << "UTC"
else
  if time.zone.kind_of_gmt?
    offset = time.offset
    ((io << (offset.negative? ? "-" : "+")) << (offset.hours.to_s.rjust(2, '0'))) << "00"
  end
end

def.name: time_zone_colon
def.body:
if time.zone.utc?
  io << "UTC"
else
  if time.zone.kind_of_gmt?
    offset = time.offset
    ((io << (offset.negative? ? "-" : "+")) << (offset.hours.to_s.rjust(2, '0'))) << ":00"
  end
end

def.name: am_pm
def.body:
string = consume_string
case string.downcase
when "am"
when "pm"
  @pm = true
else
  raise("Invalid am/pm")
end

def.name: char
def.body:
if current_char == char
  next_char
else
  raise("Unexpected char: #{char.inspect} (#{@reader.pos})")
end

def.name: consume_number_blank_padded
def.body:
if current_char.ascii_whitespace?
  max_digits = max_digits - 1
  next_char
end
consume_number(max_digits)

def.name: consume_number_i64
def.body:
n = 0_i64
char = current_char
if char.ascii_number?
  n = (char - '0').to_i64
  char = next_char
else
  raise("Expecting number")
end
max_digits = max_digits - 1
while max_digits > 0 && char.ascii_number?
  n = (n * 10) + (char - '0')
  char = next_char
  max_digits = max_digits - 1
end
n

def.name: consume_string
def.body:
start_pos = @reader.pos
while current_char.ascii_letter?
  next_char
end
@reader.string.byte_slice(start_pos, @reader.pos - start_pos)

def.name: day_name
def.body:
string = consume_string
if string.size < 3
  ::raise("Invalid day name")
end
string = string.capitalize
index = DAY_NAMES.index(&.starts_with?(string))
if index
else
  ::raise("Invalid day name")
end

def.name: epoch
def.body:
epoch_negative = false
case current_char
when '-'
  epoch_negative = true
  next_char
when '+'
  next_char
end
@epoch = (consume_number_i64(19)) * (epoch_negative ? -1 : 1)

def.name: month_name
def.body:
string = consume_string
if string.size < 3
  raise("Invalid month")
end
string = string.capitalize
index = MONTH_NAMES.index(&.starts_with?(string))
if index
  @month = 1 + index
else
  raise("Invalid month")
end

def.name: time
def.body:
if @pm
  @hour = @hour + 12
end
time_zone = (@zone || zone) || Zone.default
if @epoch
  return time_zone.epoch(@epoch.not_nil!)
end
time_zone.new(@year, @month, @day, @hour, @minute, @second, nanosecond: @nanosecond)

def.name: time_zone
def.body:
case char = current_char
when 'Z'
  @offset_in_minutes = 0
  @zone = Zone.utc
  next_char
when 'U'
  if (next_char == 'T') && (next_char == 'C')
    @offset_in_minutes = 0
    @zone = Zone.utc
    next_char
  else
    raise("Invalid timezone")
  end
when '-', '+'
  sign = char == '-' ? '+' : '-'
  char = next_char
  if char.ascii_number?
  else
    raise("Invalid timezone")
  end
  hours = char.to_i
  char = next_char
  if char.ascii_number?
  else
    raise("Invalid timezone")
  end
  hours = (10 * hours) + char.to_i
  @zone = if hours == 0
    Zone.utc
  else
    Zone.get("Etc/GMT#{sign}#{hours}")
  end
  char = next_char
  if char == ':'
    char = next_char
  end
  if char.ascii_number?
  else
    raise("Invalid timezone")
  end
  char = next_char
  if char.ascii_number?
  else
    raise("Invalid timezone")
  end
  char = next_char
  if @reader.has_next?
    pos = @reader.pos
    if (((char == ':') && next_char.ascii_number?) && @reader.has_next?) && next_char.ascii_number?
      next_char
    else
      if char.ascii_number? && next_char.ascii_number?
        next_char
      else
        @reader.pos = pos
      end
    end
  end
end

def.name: year_modulo_100
def.body:
year = consume_number(2)
if 69 <= year && year <= 99
  @year = year + 1900
else
  if 0 <= year
    @year = year + 2000
  else
    raise("Invalid year")
  end
end

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(year, month, timestamp, offset)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: default
def.body:
@@default_zone || (@@default_zone = if ENV["TZ"]?
  get(ENV["TZ"])
else
  utc
end)

def.name: get
def.body:
begin
  @@zones[name]
rescue e : KeyError
  raise(InvalidTimeZoneName.new(name))
end

instance_methods.name: new
instance_methods.args_string: (year, month, day, hour = 0, minute = 0, second = 0, *, nanosecond = 0)

def.name: new
def.body:
if ((((((1 <= year && year <= 9999) && (1 <= month && month <= 12)) && (1 <= day && day <= (::Time.days_in_month(year, month)))) && (0 <= hour && hour <= 23)) && (0 <= minute && minute <= 59)) && (0 <= second && second <= 59)) && (0 <= nanosecond && nanosecond <= 999999999)
else
  raise(ArgumentError.new("Invalid time"))
end
days = absolute_days(year, month, day)
seconds = ((((1_i64 * ::Time::SECONDS_PER_DAY) * days) + (::Time::SECONDS_PER_HOUR * hour)) + (::Time::SECONDS_PER_MINUTE * minute)) + second
new(seconds: seconds, nanoseconds: nanosecond.to_i)

def.name: new
def.body:
period = period_for_local(seconds)
Time.new(seconds: time.seconds, nanoseconds: time.nanoseconds, zone: self, period: period)

instance_methods.name: new
instance_methods.doc: TODO: add dst
instance_methods.summary: TODO add dst

def.name: new
def.body:
period = period_for_local(seconds)
Time.new(seconds: seconds, nanoseconds: nanoseconds, zone: self, period: period)
